message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.DS, cs.CL 

This paper proposes a mini-batch diversification scheme for stochastic gradient descent (SGD) that uses the Determinantal Point Process (DPP) to sample non-uniformly from the data. This approach is relevant to several sub-fields of computer science, including machine learning (cs.LG), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), computer vision (cs.CV), data structures and algorithms (cs.DS), and computational linguistics (cs.CL). The paper includes experiments on both unsupervised and supervised setups, which further supports its relevance to these sub-fields.
